greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of gap-free but not complete compositions of n.
comment: A composition is gap-free but not complete if all integers in the interval defined by the smallest and the largest part are parts but 1 is not a part.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Alois P. Heinz, Plot of (a(n)+a(n+1)-a(n+2))/a(n+2) for n = 150..1000
P. Hitczenko and A. Knopfmacher, Gap-free compositions and gap-free samples of geometric random variables, Discrete Math., 294 (2005), 225-239.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember; `if`(n=0, `if`(i=0, 0, t!),
`if`(i<1 or n<i, 0, add(b(n-i*j, i-1, t+j)/j!, j=1..n/i)))
mathematica: Array[a, 50] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 25 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 07 2014
